content: show me the course card for math 121

# MATH 121 - Linear Algebra

## Course Details
- **Instructor:** John Cain
- **Term:** Spring 2026
- **Mean Hours per Week:** 8.0 (moderate workload)
- **Overall Rating:** 4.3/5.0 (well-regarded course)

## Description
This is a second course in linear algebra, with an emphasis on understanding linear algebra at a more abstract level and learning to read and write proofs. Topics include real and complex vector spaces, linear transformations, and eigenvalues and eigenvectors.

## Requirements
**Anti-requisite:** Not to be taken in addition to Mathematics 22a, 23a, 25a, or 55a.

## Student Comments
- "Very open/exploratory course. You can tell that Dylan REALLY cares about his students. I walked away from the class learning more about my relationship with math and learning. The class could have been better with more structure but it was what I needed for the semester. It is a very easy going course."
- "Take Math 121 :)"
- "If you take this course, be sure to hold yourself accountable. Because of its looser structure, it is easy to allow yourself to fall a bit behind."

## Note
I noticed that according to your profile, you've already taken MATH 121. If you're looking for information about a different course or if you need this information for another purpose, please let me know how I can help you further.
